This game is pretty fun, it has good maps, the classes that i've played are pretty fun and the graphics, while not perfect, are definitely great from a 1999 perspective. The only problem for me is that it's pretty small with very few consistent players so there are only a few servers, and most of those servers have a good half full of bots (good bots, not the tf2 kind). Speaking of bots, you're gonna have to download a mod to get bots but overall the game is pretty good.

Also everytime you jump, it makes a grunt noise and that's funny.

I was but a most delightful young chap seraching for something to do one fucking terrible Sunday evening. suddenly my WishPhone rang, and it was my friend. He asked me: "oi mate do ya wanna play sumthin???" and i replied with "lol sure xdxdxdxddxddddd111ddxd1d"\

Later that evening, i was sent a message from my friend with something labelled as Team Fortress Classic. I opened the message, and then... it happened. the iconic line played in my ears....: "engineer gaming". I knew it. This game was going to save my life. I instantly shelled out the 5 dollars needed to purchase the game. I booted up the game, and the next thing you know, I was...... ascending. I had truly learned the art of engineer gaming. It was..... glorious.

В эту игру играл еще мой отец. Десять различных классов, каждый из которых отличается друг от друга. В своё время игра набрала нереальную популярность на Западе, но в России игру пропустили мимо глаз.

I have fond memories of playing this for countless hours growing up. It's pretty ancient now and less active, but this game will always be a unique gem with a gameplay feel that has yet to be fully recreated

This is an amazing game, however, its quite dead. you're not going to find real players often, so i highly suggest getting a bots mod (like foxbot 0.77) to play. if you don't, there are servers with bots in them. it runs well on bad/old computers, even my HP celeron toaster tron can run it very well, and its pretty small as well. (game size will grow if you join servers with mods/extra maps) and the best part is, when you download the game, you have everything in the game. there's no grinding for new items, there's no buying better gear, the only thing you have to grind, is getting better at the game. absolutely worth buying. if you like shooters, or if you want some cool games and you have a piece of crap computer, buy this.

quick tips:
1: turn off V-sync for better performance
2: its a bit buggy sometimes
3: ive heard that admins on this game are a bit nasty sometimes, so if you don't like that, play singleplayer against bots.
4: NEVER PLAY IN RESOLUTIONS LOWER THAN 640X480! Going into fulscreen on these low resolutions traps you in them, because you cant see the whole options menu. and if you go low enough, you cant play because the find lobby and create lobby buttons are gone.

its gotta be an 8/10 for me. it runs well, super fun, foxbot's are actually pretty smart. (or maybe im just really bad) and you dont have to worry about how well you do. just get out there and blow things up, however, its dead, buggy, and V-sync screws up your game, and that's not good, because its important (in my opinion)

Quizás hemos jugado al Team Fortress 2 (al menos la mayoría) sin haber jugado previamente su antecesor, que común en la época de los 90's con los juegos de Valve, este nació como un mod del Half-life para después ser un juego aparte llamado como "Team Fortress Classic", y como la mayoría del publico que jugo primero el su secuela sin anteriormente jugar la primera entrega (o tan siquiera conocerla) fue una buena experiencia observando detalladamente los grandes cambios que tuvo de un titulo para otro, tanto del apartado gráfico cambiando de una realista a uno cartoon, como a su vez algunas mecánicas de cada clase (como las granadas) que me sorprendió, digo, un pyro con lanzacohetes y un medic con escopeta es algo normal aquí pero en TF2 no, lo cual agrada ya que da mas variedad e independencia a cada clase.

Ahora bien el juego es bueno y entretenido a pesar de estar casi muerto (cosa razonable pues este juego ya tiene 23 años), aun así existen jugadores reales como a su vez servers con bots; ahora bien, ¿si vale la pena comprarlo? pues honestamente solo lo recomendaría comprarlo únicamente en el Valve complete pack y no por si solo el juego, esto debido a lo anteriormente dicho de que no este tan vivo y también por el hecho de que su secuela que es absolutamente superior en cualquier aspecto (excepto que TF Classic no tiene random crits ni tuvo problemas de bots :D) es gratis, entonces digamos que no conviene al menos que sea en el Valve complete pack.

Aun asi al igual que su secuela este entretiene mucho y si te puedes llegar a pasar buenas horas.
A very good old school game, that will launch on every pc, and you can sucessfully get it with some cs and hl games in the valve pack :)
